# contentsRect

**Instance Property**

Returns the rectangle, in unit coordinates, that contains the image within the superview.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor final var contentsRect: CGRect { get }
```

## Discussion

If your app displays the image with [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSImageView] and you assign it to the [doc://com.apple.VisionKit/documentation/VisionKit/ImageAnalysisOverlayView/trackingImageView] property, the framework doesn’t require you to implement this property.

The default value is the entire contents of the superview, which is the unit rectangle `[0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0]`.

## Managing custom image views

- **setContentsRectNeedsUpdate()**: Informs the view that contains the image when the layout changes and the view needs to reload its content.
